data.text: A protective or restorative liquid or cream applied to the skin.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A washing; particularly, a washing of the skin.
A fluid preparation, wash, or cosmetic applied to the skin, especially the skin of the face, for the purpose of rendering it smooth, soft, or fair.
In pharmacy, a liquid holding in solution various medicinal substances, applied externally to stimulate action, to relieve pain, etc.
A washing, especially of the skin for the purpose of rendering it fair.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A liquid preparation for bathing the skin, or an injured or diseased part, either for a medicinal purpose, or for improving its appearance.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A low- to medium-<xref>viscosity</xref> <xref>topical</xref> <xref>preparation</xref> intended for application to unbroken skin.

data.text: A <xref>washing</xref>, especially of the skin for the purpose of <xref>beautification</xref>.
